abstract: David Allen Critic's Notebook praises British Broadcasting Corporation as important force in promoting classical music worldwide, especially as national orchestras and broadcasters across Europe face severe budget cuts; notes that BBC, which gives needed support for emerging artists while maintaining radio station, annual Henry Wood Promenade Concerts, three choirs and five orchestras, has also been threatened with cutbacks.
lead_paragraph: The event, this year spread over eight weeks and featuring 76 major concerts, should continue to be broadcast on the national classical station.

headline.print_headline: As Austerity Looms, BBC Becomes All the More Important to Classical Music
headline.main: The Proms, BBC’s Classical Music Festival, Is All the More Important as Austerity Looms
